meanings.definition: To spoil the shape or appearance of
meanings.sent1: The heavy book deforms the soft pillow when placed on top.
meanings.sent2: The rain deforms the paper, making the ink run and the words blur.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy deforms the neat stack of papers by chewing on the corners.
meanings.sent4: The heat deforms the plastic toy, turning its once smooth surface into a wavy mess.
meanings.sent5: The artist intentionally deforms the clay sculpture to create a unique and abstract piece.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old chair deforms and loses its original shape.
meanings.sent2: The plastic bottle deforms under pressure, changing from round to flat.
meanings.sent3: The balloon deforms comically as it slowly loses air, making funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The metal deforms under the force of the hammer, bending and twisting.
meanings.sent5: The fabric deforms when stretched, causing wrinkles and creases.
